alert.note: Alert for Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 7:53PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Shasta County through 845 PM PDT... At 753 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Redding, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Redding, Palo Cedro, Shasta Lake, Anderson, Igo, Keswick, Millville, Whiskeytown, Centerville and Central Valley Cdp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County
